column5: all the parts could be sourced from tacklewarehouse, plat, japan tackle  the TDZ is an MG reel so anodizing won't be an option and I want a pearl effect  milling knobs sounds interesting, if you can turn out some titanium knobs, I'll definitely be interested
ahhhh pearl! that makes sense!  Good point on the MG, I guess I'll try my Revo first.

my custom TDZ   TDZ103ML w/ Custom Lexus Starfire Pearl Paint RCS 1012 Spool Zillion Type R Drag Star Zillion Type R Handle Anodized Red Screws Bassart handle knobs Carbontex Drag Boca Abec 7               And while I got the reel painted, I also got some knobs painted Candy Apple Red, went nicely with my PXL-R
sweet reel !!! Enjoy !!!
wOW the Daiwa looks amazing, you have some skills. Wanna do my reels
Very nice buddie!
That's pure sex right there. Nice set up
I'll give you $50 for it when you have it up for sale in the classified section at the end of the season  Joking aside...sweet looking reel.
Sweet... now gettem all slimed up.
Great looking reel man!

Very nice work... I do custom airbrush painting on bikes, cars, and anything else that will stand still long enough, even my dishwasher... Never thought to do a reel. Is it automotive grade paint? Clear? etc? Thanks for showing....
i gotta ask  how much did it cost for the reel and the custom work?
I must be sooooooo cheap because if I had reels like that they'd never see the light of day. They'd be sitting on a pedestal by my desk so clients could ooohhhhaahhhhh at them.
I wonder if you could lower it?. lol.,sweet looking for sure!!!
Too bad you're left handed - When you get bored of your 2012 reels and get reels for 2013, I would have taken some of them from you! lol.  Super nice reels btw.
Oh man.. Those look Bad  Very nice!
automotive paint, primer, paint, paint, clean coat   around $600 ~ $700 for everything including the reel, parts and paint job
Nice....does it catch more fish??
nope, it catches more people than fish now

any tool cheaper than the Boca pliers work on removing the spool pin? I used reg pliers on my alpha but dont want to chance damaging the spool on my steez, dont want to spend $40 for changing bearings on one reel!  Nice reel btw, i sold my tdz, regret it
Now that there is just sick......Nice job !

http://www.plat.co.jp/shop/catalog/product_info/language/en/products_id/14329/spool-bearing-remover-type-s.html  both tools work great..  you can always do the hammer punch but you risk damaging things
Thanks, looks like ill be purchasing the boca

Nice work but why the auto paint???   this stuff should be done using a single stage polyurethane over epoxy.   best yet, anodize all the AL bits before the primer.    . . . after the season I'll make a step by step from stripping to anodizing to paint. Might even mill out some knobs .....  where do you get all them shiny bits? can you post a few links where I could get some ideas?
droooooooooooooool
Wow. You should see my reels paint...  That's a pretty reel if it's your thing. Looks good.
